Welcome to Python Hangman!¶

A Python TDD Experiment¶

My first python agnostic, tox tested, travis-backed, program!

Has very high unit test coverage, with passing tests on every version of python including PyPy.

Compatibility¶

  • Python 2.6
  • Python 2.7
  • Python 3.2
  • Python 3.3
  • Python 3.4
  • PyPy

Quick Start¶

mkvirtualenv hangman  # optional for venv users
pip install python_hangman

hangman

Uninstall

pip uninstall python_hangman

Goal¶

Learning! Python in this case. I’m particularly interested in testing and Test Driven Development. This was a TDD exercise.

Also, explored:

  • Tox, test automation
  • Travis CI
  • Python version agnostic programming
  • Setuptools
  • Publishing on pip
  • Coverage via coveralls

Design¶

There are 3 main components that run the game: hangman.Hangman, hangman.Commander, and hangman.Presenter

The entirety of the game logic is contained in hangman.Hangman. You could technically play the game in the python console by instantiating the class, submitting guesses with Hangman.guess(self, letter) and printing the game state.

For example:

>>> from hangman.hangman import Hangman
>>> game = Hangman(answer='hangman')
>>> game.guess('a')
hangman(status='_A___A_', misses=[], remaining_turns=10)

>>> game.guess('n').guess('z').guess('e')
hangman(status='_AN__AN', misses=['Z', 'E'], remaining_turns=8)

>>> game.status, game.misses, game.remaining_turns
('_AN__AN', ['Z', 'E'], 8)

hangman.Presenter is a simple presentation layer. It handles printing the art to the console, and collecting input from the user

The hangman.Commander is exactly that, the commander, the director, the maestro, the tour guide. It guides you, the user, through the game. It tells the presenter module what to print and what data to collect. The commander updates the state of the game and handles game events.

Design Reasoning¶

This design pattern was the right choice, because I didn’t know, in advance, how the game was to interact with the user. Curses was on the table, it still is. But, following TDD, there needed to be an immediate working solution that could be swapped out in the future. And that’s what this design allows. The presenter class can changed to any other presentation layer with out changing the game.

Code Documentation¶

hangman.__init__ module¶

A well tested, cli, python version-agnostic, multi-platform hangman game. It’s built following TDD principles and each component services a sensibly distinct logical purpose.

hangman.commander module¶

This module is responsible for guiding the user throught the game.

class hangman.commander.Commander(hangman=<class 'hangman.hangman.Hangman'>, presenter=<class hangman.presenter.Presenter>)[source]¶

The commander guides the user through the game, by telling the presenter what information to collect and what data to show and updating the status of the game.

Start the tour.

  • presenter – Presenter dependence injection.

An instance of self.

hangman.dictionary module¶

This module is called to choose a random word for the game.

class hangman.dictionary.Dictionary[source]¶

Callable class that returns a random word from a static dictionary.

hangman.hangman module¶

This module contains all of the game logic.

exception hangman.hangman.GameOver[source]¶

Indicate conditions for losing have been met.

exception hangman.hangman.GameWon[source]¶

Indicate conditions for winning have been met.

class hangman.hangman.Hangman(answer=None, dictionary=<class 'hangman.dictionary.Dictionary'>)[source]¶

The hangman game object contains the logic for managing the status of the game and raising key game related events.

>>> from hangman.hangman import Hangman
>>> game = Hangman(answer='hangman')
>>> game.guess('a')
hangman(status='_A___A_', misses=[], remaining_turns=10)
>>> game.guess('n').guess('z').guess('e')
hangman(status='_AN__AN', misses=['Z', 'E'], remaining_turns=8)
>>> game.status, game.misses, game.remaining_turns
('_AN__AN', ['Z', 'E'], 8)

Return type:str

hangman.presenter module¶

This module handles user interaction. Printing and prompting.

class hangman.presenter.Presenter(click=<module 'click' from '/home/manu/.envs/hm/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/click/__init__.pyc'>)[source]¶

Print and prompt. This class is used by the commander to collect and present data. Makes extensive use of click’s library.

write(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Present the game status with pictures.

Clears the screen. Flashes any messages. Zip the two halves of the picture together.

Parameters:
  • game (hangman.Hangman) – game instance
  • message – flash message
  • game_over (bool) – GameOver has been raised
  • game_won (bool) – GameWon has been raised
Returns:

self
